content: 4 cc row 12 152 cc row 13 repeat row 11 row 14 repeat row 10 row 15 repeat row 9 row 16 repeat row 8 row 17 repeat row 7 row 18-19 repeat row 5 row 20-22 repeat row 2 row 23-127 repeat row 2-22 5 more times fasten_off and weave in any ends some cc yarn showing through is normal if you see too much cc yarn for your liking try using a smaller hook canyon moon rising crochet pattern © 2025 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful canyon moon rising pattern repeat chart each square of this chart represents 2 double_crochet stitches each pattern repeat is 38 stitches across and 21 row tall pattern tutorial video https //youtu be/9ugpv_rdbcu changing colors tapestry crochet both colors of yarn are carried throughout the whole blanket lay the yarn you are not using on top of the row of stitches below and crochet over it to hide it then pick it back up again when you are ready to use it and lay the other color yarn down over the row below and crochet over it to change colors in the blanket you will yarn over with the new color one stitch before the first double_crochet with the new color here is how 1 in the stitch before the color change complete the double_crochet stitch as usual but do not perform the last yarn over yet yarn over with the new color black shown here and pull through both loops on the hook canyon moon rising crochet pattern © 2025 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful 2 insert hook into next stitch and gently tug both yarn ends to avoid loose loops of yarn sticking out avoid the temptation to pull very tightly complete a double_crochet stitch as usual with dark yarn do not cut the light yarn lay it over the row below and crochet over it 3 when you are ready to change back to light yarn yarn over with it in the last yarn over of your last dark double_crochet stitch do not cut the dark yarn lay it over the row below and continue to crochet with light yarn wrapping the dark yarn with your stitches to hide it to keep the yarns from tangling put one ball of yarn in front and one ball in back at your side when you have to pick up a new color of yarn follow that yarn from the ball to pick it up https //youtu be/9ugpv_rdbcu for example when you drop the green yarn in this photo to switch to the ivory yarn drop it toward the back of your work and pick up the ivory from the front when you drop the ivory yarn in this photo to switch to green drop the ivory by moving it toward the front of your work and pick up the green from the back this keeps the lines from getting crossed or wrapped around each other adding a new cake
